info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 4:17PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Meade and central Pennington Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 416 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southeastern Ellsworth Air Force Base, or 9 miles northeast of Rapid City, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Eastern Rapid Valley around 420 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Rapid City Airport. This includes Interstate 90 in South Dakota between Mile Markers 63 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for west central South Dakota.
